summary: Comprehensive testing of Block UI-4 (Network Evidence) and Block UI-5 (Compare Panel). All 17 backend API tests passed. Frontend components render correctly with data and empty states. All three panels (Token Mentions, Network Evidence, Compare) display properly for alpha_channel.
passed_tests: ✅ GET /api/telegram-intel/channel/:username/network-evidence returns correct structure (ok, username, count, summary, items)
✅ Network Evidence items have required fields: token, earlyRank, cohortSize, delayHours, percentile, return7d, isHit, mentionedAt
✅ alpha_channel has expected tokens ($ARB, $OP) in network evidence
✅ Empty response (ok=true, count=0) for channels without evidence (durov)
✅ Username normalization working for network-evidence endpoint
✅ Limit query parameter works for network-evidence endpoint
✅ GET /api/telegram-intel/channel/:username/compare returns correct structure
✅ Compare endpoint returns current field with intelScore, tier, components
✅ Compare endpoint returns position field with rank, total, percentile, percentileLabel
✅ Compare endpoint returns gaps field with up, down, toTierS, toTierA
✅ Compare endpoint returns neighbors field with prev, next, prev2, next2
✅ Compare endpoint returns peerContext with tier, peersInTier, tierAverage, vsAverage
✅ alpha_channel is rank #1/3 and Tier A as expected
✅ Unranked channels return ok=false, error='not_found' for compare endpoint
✅ Username normalization working for compare endpoint
✅ Both endpoints return consistent username
✅ Non-existent channels handled gracefully by both endpoints
✅ ComparePanel component renders with Global Rank, Percentile, Distance to Tier S
✅ NetworkEvidenceTable component renders with Early Rank, Delay, Percentile, 7d ROI, Cohort columns
✅ NetworkEvidenceTable shows $ARB (rank 1/5, 20% percentile, +40.0% ROI)
✅ NetworkEvidenceTable shows $OP (rank 2/5, 40% percentile, +35.0% ROI)
✅ Empty state for durov: 'NO TOKEN MENTIONS' and 'NO NETWORK ALPHA EVIDENCE' displayed correctly
✅ Compare Panel not rendered for unranked durov channel (correct behavior)
seed_data_creation: Used existing test channels: alpha_channel (with data), durov (without data)
context_for_next_testing_agent: Network Evidence and Compare Panel endpoints fully tested. Test file at /app/backend/tests/test_network_alpha_evidence_compare.py for regression testing. alpha_channel has 2 tokens in network evidence ($ARB, $OP) and is rank #1/3 Tier A. durov channel has no data and returns empty states correctly. WebSocket connections show intermittent errors but do not affect API functionality.
